title: Ticket #1268: condor cron with local universe not cleaning up execute dir
description: more evidence needs to be collected, but i saw a local_univ_execute dir that was maxed out with dir_<pid>, where every pid existed. i suspect there is a simple bug in cleaning up (since the starter is under the schedd, not startd), or possibly a privilege problem when using local universe with cron functionality. i am looking into it with scot. no new local universe jobs can execute once this state is reached.
remarks:
2010-Mar-10 16:27:28 by kronenfe:
I saved the config files and log files in vdt-itb:~kronenfe/condor-cron-problem/

I checked with another site running the same version of Condor-Cron, and they did not have a problem with the directory filling up. They had recently restarted condor-cron (but so had I, I think).

Since no other site has seen this problem since running RSV for the last year+ - that we're aware of at least - I think this is not high priority. I'm a bit nervous that this problem exists, and I'd like to know what triggered it, but it seems like a really rare case that is probably not worth too much time investigating.
